DataElement.preferredName: Patient Elevated Bilirubin Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient has Gilbert's disease or a similar syndrome, resulting in elevated bilirubin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Elevated Bilirubin Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the reporting of medical events describing a disorder characterized by elevated bilirubin (excessive concentrations of bilirubin in the blood, which may lead to jaundice).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Excessive concentrations of bilirubin in the blood, which may lead to jaundice.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Abnormally high level of bilirubin in the blood. Excess bilirubin is associated with jaundice.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have Gilbert
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have Gilbert's disease or a similar syndrome due to slow conjugation of bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total bilirubin >1.5 mg/dL due to Gilbert's syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does this patient have a grade 1 bilirubin elevation (> ULN to 1.5 x ULN) resulting from Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome due to slow conjugation of bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is bilirubin elevation due to Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome involving slow conjugation of bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient known to have Gilbert's Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the bilirubin within normal range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented Gilbert's syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN (CTEP Active Version CTCAE Grade 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented Gilbert's syndrome OR is the total bilirubin >2 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) due to non-Hodgkin's lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's total bilirubin greater than 1.5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have Gilbert's Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's total bilirubin >=1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal due to liver involvement, hemolysis, or Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have documented Gilbert's syndrome or is hyperbilirubinemia clearly attributed to liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1501
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have Gilberts Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a bilirubin elevation > 1.5 X ULN to 3 X ULN due to Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome involving slow conjugation of bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented Gilberts disease or elevated bilirubin believed by investigator to be due to leukemic infiltration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have liver involvement, hemolysis, or documented Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have documented Gilberts syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known Gilbert's disease with bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented Gilbert's Syndrome or documented liver or pancreatic involvement by lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known Gilbert's disease with bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known Gilbert's disease with bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 x ULN within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance A032001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented Gilberts syndrome or liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have Gilbertâ€™s disease or similar syndrome involving slow conjugation of bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known Gilbert's disease with bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 x institutional ULN?
